info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 7:22PM MDT until June 25 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, northwestern Adams, far southeast Boulder, and Broomfield Counties.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 720 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area in 30 minutes or less. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thornton, northeastern Westminster, Broomfield, northern Commerce City, northern Northglenn, Brighton, Todd Creek and Henderson.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, underpasses, drainage areas and other low lying spots.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Adams, CO; Boulder, CO; Broomfield, CO
